alert.note: Alert for Flathead (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 10:30AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Flathead County Trumbell Creek west of Columbia Falls and other small streams along Highway 2 from Columbia Falls to West Glacier. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1024 AM MDT, Heavy rainfall reported. This could cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain could result in minor flooding for small streams and creeks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
